properties.headline: NYE in Greenwich - Thursday 31 December - GREENWICH Albert St, East St, George St, Gother Ave, O'Connell St, Prospect St and Victoria St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and changed access arrangements will be in place in Greenwich this New Year’s Eve.

Road closures will be in place on sections of Albert St, East St, George St, Gother Ave, O'Connell St, Prospect St and Victoria St from 9pm NYE until 1am New Year's Day. 

During this time one way traffic arrangements will also be in place on Manns Ave, George St between Manns Ave and St Lawrence St and St Lawrence St between George St and Manns Ave.

arrangementElements.html:
GREENWICH 

FROM 9PM THURSDAY 31 DECEMBER 2020 UNTIL 1AM FRIDAY 1 JANUARY 2021

  • Albert Street from George Street
  • East Street from Prospect Street
  • George Street East of Manns Avenue
  • Gother Ave from Manns Ave
  • O’Connell Street from Albert Street
  • Prospect Street from Victoria Road to end of street
  • Victoria Street from George Street

properties.headline: NYE in the Balmain Peninsula - Thursday 31 December - BALMAIN, DRUMMOYNE, ROZELLE & BIRCHGROVE Victoria Road at Darling St, Evans St, McKell St and Wharf Rd
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE Road cloures and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE Road cloures and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year’s Eve in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

From 3pm roads into Balmain East & Birchgrove off Victoria Rd will close including sections of Darling St, Evans St, McKell St and Wharf Rd.

There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm. Access will be maintained for residents on select roads with passes, buses, taxis (until 7pm) and other authorised vehicles only.

Roads will reopen from 12:30am on New Year's Day or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Traffic may be heavy exiting the area so be patient or delay your travel.

Special event clearways will be in effect on Victoria Rd between The Crescent and Westbourne St (westbound) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location. Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

ROZELLE/DRUMMOYNE 

FROM 3PM THURSDAY 31 DECEMBER TO 2AM FRIDAY 1 JANUARY 2021

  • Victoria Road between the Crescent and Westbourne Street (westbound)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: NYE at Taronga Zoo - Thursday 31 December - MOSMAN Athol Wharf Road - Bradleys Head Road
properties.publicTransport: Ferries will not run after 5pm. Shuttle buses will run between the Zoo and Spit Junction. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in place for New Year’s Eve (NYE) at Taronga Zoo.

Bradleys Head Rd and Athol Wharf Rd approaching the Zoo will close from 5pm on NYE until 2am New Year's Day (NYD).

Special event clearways will be in place between 3pm NYE and 2am NYD on sections of Athol Wharf Rd, Bradley Head Rd and Whiting Beach Rd. Clearways will also be in place on sections of Spit Rd from 3pm NYE to 3am NYD, and sections of of Military Rd from 6pm NYE to 3am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
FROM 5PM 31 DECEMBER 2020 TO 2AM 1 JANUARY 2021

  • Athol Wharf Road* between Bradleys Head Road and Athol Wharf
  • Bradleys Head Road** between Whiting beach Road and Athol Wharf Road         

Notes:

**Access allowed for emergency service vehicles

*Access allowed for Sydney Buses, Taronga Zoo shuttle buses, National Parks, Taronga Zoo staff and emergency service vehicles

properties.headline: NYE in North Sydney - Thursday 31 December - NORTH SYDNEY, MCMAHONS POINT, KIRRIBILLI various roads
properties.publicTransport: Most ferries will not run after 5pm, with limited services running to Barangaroo only after this time. Due to road closures buses will use stops on Pacific Hwy & Miller St from 7pm. From 11pm buses will terminate at North Sydney while the Harbour Bridge is closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE 2020 North Sydney & surrounds - Road Closure & Clearways Map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE 2020 North Sydney & surrounds - Road Closure & Clearways Map

properties.otherAdvice:
Roads will close in McMahons Point, Lavender Bay, Milsons Point, Kirribilli, Cremorne Point and Kurraba Point this New Year's Eve to allow people to move around safely and practise physical distancing. Most roads in these areas remain closed until 3am on New Year's Day

Please note that access to some venues around Sydney Harbour in the city is restricted to NYE passholders only. Visit nsw.gov.au/nye for details.

Key road closure times

  • From 3pm: Olympic Drive in Kirribilli will be closed until 3am.
  • From 5pm: The Cahill Expressway lanes 7 + 8 southbound and the High St and Mount St on-ramps will be closed until 6am. In McMahons Point and Lavender Bay, Blues Point Rd and Lavender Crescent will be closed until 3am. In Cremorne Point sections of Milsons Rd near the waterfront will be closed until 3am - access will be maintained for local residents between 5pm and 7pm.  
  • From 7pm: various roads around North Sydney Station and in McMahons Point, Lavender Bay, Milsons Point and Kirribilli will be closed until 3am. Access will be maintained for residents on most roads until 9pm. In Kurraba Point sections of Kurraba Rd and Baden Rd will be closed until 3am. Note that Lavender St and Union Rd, and roads in Waverton remain open this year.
  • From 11pm: the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions until 1.30am.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on various local roads in these areas as well as major roads including Miller St, Falcon St and Military Rd from 3pm New Year’s Eve until 3am New Year’s Day.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even if you have a local resident parking permit or Mobility Scheme Parking permit. Please check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:

Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

properties.headline: NYE in the Sydney CBD - Thursday 31 December - SYDNEY CBD, CIRCULAR QUAY, THE ROCKS roads north of Market St
properties.publicTransport: From 5pm, buses in Circular Quay will relocate to Martin Place, from 7pm most buses will operate from temporary terminals at Hyde Park, Town Hall and Wynyard. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney CBD NYE - Road Closures & Clearways Map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney CBD NYE - Road Closures & Clearways Map

properties.otherAdvice:
Roads in the city will start to close from 2pm this New Year's Eve to allow everyone to move around the Sydney CBD safely and practise physical distancing. Most roads remain closed until 4am on New Year's Day. 

Please note that access to some venues around Sydney Harbour in the city is restricted to NYE passholders only. Visit nsw.gov.au/nye for details.

Key road closure timings

  • From 2pm: roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks including sections of George St, Hickson Rd, Young St, Phillip St and Macquarie St* will be closed. * Access to Macquarie St will be maintained for residents/guests until 5pm.
  • From 4pm: roads in The Rocks including sections of Cumberland St, Harrington St, Gloucester St and Argyle St will be closed.
  • From 5pm: The Cahill Expressway southbound and roads in Circular Quay including Pitt St, Alfred St and Loftus St will be closed.
  • From 7pm: sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St and College St will be closed.
  • From 10pm: roads around Wynyard including sections of York St, Clarence St, King St, Margaret St, Erskine St and other nearby roads will be closed.
  • From 11pm: the Sydney Harbour Bridge in both directions, the Cahill Expressway Overpass westbound lanes and the citybound lanes of the Anzac Bridge will be closed until 1.30am.

Most roads will reopen by 4am on New Year’s Day 1 January once infrastructure is safely removed from the roadway. The Harbour Bridge and Anzac Bridge will reopen by 1.30am, while the Cahill Expressway lanes 7 + 8 and eastbound lanes of the Circular Quay Overpass will remain closed until 6am on New Year’s Day.

Special event clearways will be in effect in the city on roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks from 12pm midday on New Year’s Eve 31 December until 4am on New Year’s Day 1 January. On various roads from Bridge St to Goulburn St in the city’s south, clearways will be in effect from 3pm on New Year’s Eve 31 December until 4am on New Year’s Day 1 January.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Walkway and cycleway closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise.

properties.headline: NYE in Kurraba Point - Thursday 31 December - KURRABA POINT Kurraba Road and Baden Road

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE 2020 North Shore Road Closure & Clearway map - 31 Dec 2020
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE 2020 North Shore Road Closure & Clearway map - 31 Dec 2020

properties.otherAdvice: In Kurraba Point sections of Kurraba Rd from Shellcove Rd and Baden Rd from Kurraba Rd at the waterfront will be closed on New Year's Eve from 7pm until 3am on New Year's Day.
properties.displayName: NYE in Kurraba Point - Thursday 31 December

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW NYE 2020 Interactive Road Closure Map

properties.headline: NYE in Cremorne Point - Thursday 31 December - CREMORNE POINT Milson Road between Cremorne Road AND Cremorne Point Wharf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE 2020 North Shore Road Closure & Clearway Map - 31 Dec 2020
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE 2020 North Shore Road Closure & Clearway Map - 31 Dec 2020

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place at Cremorne Point for New Year's Eve.

From 5pm NYE until 3am NYD Milsons Rd will be closed between Cremorne Rd and Cremorne Point Wharf.

Access will be maintained for local residents between 5pm and 7pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect on this section of Milsons Rd from 3pm NYE until 3am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.
properties.displayName: NYE in Cremorne Point - Thursday 31 December

properties.headline: A-League - Thursday 31 December - GOSFORD Dane Dr between Central Coast Hwy AND Donnison St
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Newcastle Jets from 7:05pm to approx 9pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as soccer fans travel to and from the event.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 5pm and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 3 January - LEUMEAH Pembroke Rd and Rose Payten Dr approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Macarthur FC v Central Coast Mariners from 4pm to approx 6pm at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr, Leumeah Rd, Airds Rd, Plough Inn Rd and Campbelltown Rd as fans travel to the game.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Rd and Rose Payten Dr

properties.headline: A-League - Friday 8 January - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd at Turton Rd
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Western Sydney Wanderers at McDonald Jones Stadium from 7:05pm until 9pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Cricket - Thursday 7 to Monday 11 January - MOORE PARK Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Lang Rd, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park walking & transport route map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park walking & transport route map

properties.otherAdvice:
New Year’s Test: Australia v India Australia v India at The SCG daily from 10:30am until 5:30pm approx.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as cricket fans travel to and from each match. 

Driver Ave is partially closed and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads around Moore Park from 6am until 7pm each day on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK - THURSDAY 7 TO MONDAY 11 JANUARY

FROM 6AM TO 7PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Lang Rd, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 2 January - WOLLONGONG Harbour St and Burelli St at WIN Stadium
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Wellington Phoenix v Sydney FC from 5pm until 7pm approx at WIN Stadium.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Road closures will be in place on sections of Harbour St between Stewart St and Crown St and Burelli St between Corrimal St and Harbour St from 3pm to 7:30pm. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: A-League - Wednesday 30 December - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Macarthur FC at Bankwest Stadium kick off from 7.10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time to allow crowds to safely leave the area including sections of O’Connell St, Victoria Rd and Ross St.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW NYE 2020 Interactive Road Closure Map

properties.headline: NYE in Coogee Beach - Thursday 31 December - COOGEE Arden St, Coogee Bay Rd, Dolphin St and Hill St
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be permitted through the closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE Coogee road closures and clearways
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE Coogee road closures and clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
While there will not be a New Year's Eve event at Coogee Beach this year, road closures and clearways will still be in place on the night to allow everyone to practise physical distancing.

Road closures:

  • From 12pm midday to 9.30pm - Alfreda St between Arden St and Brook St will close. 
  • From 7pm to 9.30pm - sections of Arden St, Brook St, Coogee Bay Rd, Dolphin St, Hill St and Vicar St will close.

Special event clearways will be in place on sections of Arden St, Brook St, Alfreda St, Coogee Bay Rd and Dolphin St from 12pm midday until 9:30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
FROM 12PM MIDDAY TO 9.30PM - THURSDAY 31 DECEMBER 2020

  • Alfreda Street between Arden Street and Brook Street

FROM 7PM TO 9:30PM - THURSDAY 31 DECEMBER 2020

  • Arden Street between Bream Street and Carr Street
  • Brook Street between Dolphin Street and Coogee Bay Road          
  • Coogee Bay Road between Arden Street and Brook Street
  • Dolphin Street between Arden Street and Brook Street       
  • Hill Street between Bream Street and Dolphin Street         
  • Ormond Gardens from Brook Street and end of street
  • Vicar Street from Coogee Bay Road and end of street
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location. Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

FROM 12PM MIDDAY TO 9:30PM - THURSDAY 31 DECEMBER 2020

  • Arden Street* between Dolphin Street and Coogee Bay Rd (both sides)
  • Arden Street between Coogee Bay Road and Carr Street (both sides)
  • Brook Street between Australia Post Driveway no 120 and Coogee Bay Rd (western side)
  • Alfreda Street between Arden Street and Brook Street (both sides)
  • Coogee Bay Road between Arden Street and Brook Street (both sides)
  • Dolphin Street* between Arden Street and Brook Street (both sides)

Notes:

*Authorised Route Buses Excepted

properties.headline: NYE in Gladesville - Thursday 31 December - GLADESVILLE Victoria Road at Gladesville Bridge Walkway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.
properties.otherAdvice:
The footpath on the eastern side of the Gladesville Bridge will be closed from 6pm New Year's Eve until 1am New Year's Day between Huntleys Point Rd and Cambridge Rd. The western side of the walkway will remain open. 

Lane closures on the Gladesville Bridge may be implemented at the discretion of NSW Police.

Please note security will be on-site from 6am and will move on anyone gathering on the bridge. There are no fireworks on the western side of the Harbour this year.

properties.headline: NYE in Hunters Hill - Thursday 31 December - HUNTERS HILL Church Street at Burns Bay Road
properties.publicTransport: Buses will not continue to Woolwich after 11am due to road closures, no ferries will stop at Woolwich wharf after 11.30am. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be place this New Year's Eve in Hunters Hill and Woolwich.

From 11am access to the Hunters Hill/Woolwich Peninsula will be closed at the Church St and Reiby Rd intersection until 2am New Year's Day. From 11:30pm NYE until 1:30am NYD the Burns Bay off-ramp to Church St may also close.

After 11am, access will be maintained for residents and authorised passholders only.  

Special event clearways will be in effect from 11am NYE to 2am NYD on various roads including sections of The Avenue, Church St, Victoria Rd, Burns Bay Rd off-ramp, Alexandra St and Woolwich Rd.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
HUNTERS HILL 

FROM 11AM 31 DECEMBER 2020 TO 2AM 1 JANUARY 2021

  • Access to Woolwich Peninsula will be restrickted to residents only. Only people residing on the Peninsula, east of Church Street overpass and possessing proof of residency will be permitted to enter.
  • A check point will be established at the intersection of Church St and Reiby Rd. Visitors will be allowed access only when collected by residents at the check point. 
  • A resident in a sign written taxi with proof of residence will be permitted to enter. Deliveries and other transport, including buses and ride shares, will not be allowed past the check point.

FROM 11:30PM 31 December 2020 TO 1:30AM 1 January 2021

  • Burns Bay off-ramp to Church St*

*When ramps are closed an alternate route is available via Victoria Rd

Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

properties.headline: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS - Taronga Zoo Summer Holiday period - MOSMAN Bradleys Head Road approaching Taronga Zoo
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to visit Taronga Zoo during the holiday period between 26 December and 4 January. Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching the Zoo including Military Rd. 

When Taronga Zoo car park and nearby street parking is nearing capacity, the following roads to and from the Zoo will progressively close between 9am and 1pm as required each day:

  • Bradleys Head Rd from Athol Wharf Rd to Whiting Beach Rd
  • Athol Wharf Rd between Bradleys Head Rd and Taronga Zoo Wharf roundabout. 

Traffic controllers will be on site managing parking and traffic flow along Bradleys Head Rd at the Zoo car park.

Access will be maintained for buses and ferry wharf passengers as well as patrons of the Athol Hall Function Centre and the Sydney Harbour National Park.
properties.displayName: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS - Taronga Zoo Summer Holiday period
